poem:
"Defection in Autumn"

Tory leaves drift, a red coat scorned,
Dan Poulter, now Labour adorned.
Rishi stands in the storm's wake,
An NHS crisis in the quake.
Yet the poll dance continues, unabated,
In England and Wales, voters awaited.
The ship of state, listing, unnerving,
A prime minister undeserving. 
Adrift, with trust irrevocably spurned,
The tables of power slowly turned.
